page.title: 04ECOLOGY AROUND COILACRIECH
page.content: 2. The pinewood community. Beneath the pine trees is a characteristic ground cover which includes blaeberry and heather. Other plants which are often found include cowberry, wavy hair-grass, chickweed wintergreen, creeping lady's tresses, lesser twayblade, the true wintergreens, twinflowers and many mosses. Roe deer,red squirrels and rabbits are common animals in the woods. In winter when food is scarce they cause harm by stripping the bark off young trees. Wild cats and badgers are rarer animals that are sometimes seen. Many woodland birds are to be found in the area. The crossbill has a beak that is adapted for pulling the scales from cones to get the seeds.By far the most numerous however are chaffinches,coal tits and bullfinches.
